Class IR

java.lang.Object
Election
IR
public class IR
extends Election
The IR class is in charge of running an Instant Runoff election and outputting any results to the audit file, media report, and display.
Author:
Mohammad Essawy, Michael Markiewicz, Justin Lam

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class Election

    auditString, totalNumBallots

    The constructor for IR initializes the IR class so it is ready to run the IR algorithm.

  • Constructor Details

    • IR

      public IR​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> ballots, java.util.ArrayList<Candidate> candidates, int totalNumBallots)
      The constructor for IR initializes the IR class so it is ready to run the IR algorithm. It is assumed that the candidates have been initialized with the candidates for the election, and that the totalNumBallots is positive.
      Parameters:
      candidates - a list of candidates in the election.
      ballots - a hashmap containing all the votes cast
      totalNumBallots - the total number of ballots cast for this election.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the totalNumBallots or numSeatsAvailable is nonpositive, or the parties is null or empty.

  • Method Details

    • runVotingAlgorithm

      public void runVotingAlgorithm()
      Main function to run voting algorithm for IR. It will check for majority each round if majority is not found it will eliminate a candidate and redistribute votes. It will repeat those three steps until a winner is found. Then, it will output results and generate audit and media files.
      Specified by:
      runVotingAlgorithm in class Election

    • updateAuditAndElectionStatistics

      protected void updateAuditAndElectionStatistics()
      Updates the audit and election statistics strings with the current count distribution

    • addNCountToStatistics

      protected java.lang.String addNCountToStatistics​(int n)
      Takes the current roundCount formats the string for the auditString and electionStatistics (i.e., 2 becomes 2nd, 3 becomes 3rd, etc.)
      Parameters:
      n - the current round
      Returns:
      Formatted string for nth round count

    • generateAuditFile

      protected void generateAuditFile() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates the audit file and outputs the auditString to the new file.
      Specified by:
      generateAuditFile in class Election
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file was not created successfully

    • generateMediaFile

      protected void generateMediaFile() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates the media file and outputs the election results, seat election statistics, and final Notes to the new file.
      Specified by:
      generateMediaFile in class Election
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file was not created successfully

    • getWinner

      public Candidate getWinner()
      Returns the winner of the election. Will be null before the algorithm is run.
      Returns:
      The winner of the IR election.
